content: In 2003, the City of New Haven administered exams for firefighter promotions. The results showed a significant racial disparity, with white candidates dominating the top positions. City officials faced pressure from firefighters who claimed the test was racially discriminatory. Some firefighters threatened to sue over potential promotions based on the test, while others argued it was fair. The city ultimately did not certify the exam, leading to a lawsuit by white firefighters alleging discrimination under Title VII and the Fourteenth Amendment.
